intro: Equilabium wollastonii, commonly known as the Wollaston's bellflower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with five petals that are symmetrically arranged. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
